official_title: A bill to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to require multi-channel video programming distributors to provide a kid-friendly tier of programming.
short_title: Kid Friendly TV Programming Act of 2005

summary.text: Kid Friendly TV Programming Act of 2005 - Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to require multi-channel video programming distributors to provide: (1) a child-friendly programming tier of at least 15 channels; and (2) channel blocking instructions as part of the monthly bill. Imposes civil monetary penalties for violations of this Act. Defines "child-friendly tier."
